title: Servant Leadership Performance Evaluation Rubric
description: A four-level rubric (1-Developing to 4-Exemplary) evaluating leaders on empowerment, psychological safety, human growth, inclusive leadership, and ethical stewardship - the five pillars of servant leadership.

competencies.name: Empowerment & Delegation
competencies.developing: Retains most decision-making authority; delegates only routine tasks with frequent check-ins; struggles to trust team members with significant responsibilities.
competencies.competent: Delegates defined tasks and provides direction; beginning to trust team judgment on day-to-day decisions; supports team members when they take initiative.
competencies.proficient: Delegates tasks with clear guidelines; provides necessary resources; avoids micromanaging daily execution.
competencies.exemplary: Actively sponsors team members for advanced roles; pushes decision-making authority to the lowest capable level; champions team successes publicly.
competencies.evidenceSource: 360-degree feedback surveys; project delivery autonomy metrics

competencies.name: Psychological Safety & Trust
competencies.developing: Reacts defensively to criticism or dissent; team members hesitate to share ideas or admit mistakes; blame is assigned when errors occur.
competencies.competent: Generally receptive to feedback; beginning to model vulnerability by acknowledging own learning areas; team members feel comfortable raising most concerns.
competencies.proficient: Acknowledges personal mistakes openly; creates an environment where staff feel safe to voice concerns or dissenting opinions.
competencies.exemplary: Institutionalizes a 'blameless' post-mortem culture; actively rewards employees who challenge the status quo to drive sustainable innovation.
competencies.evidenceSource: Turnover rates; frequency of employee-initiated process improvements

competencies.name: Commitment to Human Growth
competencies.developing: Focuses primarily on task completion; development conversations are infrequent or limited to mandatory reviews; little awareness of individual career aspirations.
competencies.competent: Conducts regular development conversations; identifies basic training needs; supports employees attending relevant courses and workshops.
competencies.proficient: Facilitates access to necessary training; aligns individual career trajectories with organizational objectives.
competencies.exemplary: Serves as a dedicated mentor; willing to sacrifice short-term team productivity to allow employees to pursue high-value, cross-functional learning.
competencies.evidenceSource: Internal mobility rates; completion rates of advanced training programs

competencies.name: Inclusive Leadership
competencies.developing: Limited awareness of personal biases; team discussions are dominated by a few voices; diversity and inclusion are not actively considered in decision-making.
competencies.competent: Shows growing awareness of bias and privilege; makes intentional efforts to include quieter voices in meetings; participates in DEI learning opportunities.
competencies.proficient: Demonstrates awareness of implicit biases; ensures diverse voices are solicited and heard during team meetings.
competencies.exemplary: Systematically dismantles systemic barriers to equity within their department; leads initiatives fostering deep, authentic community belonging.
competencies.evidenceSource: Employee Belonging Index scores; diversity metrics within the managed team

competencies.name: Ethical Stewardship & Sustainability
competencies.developing: Sustainability and ethics are considered only when externally mandated; decisions prioritize short-term gains without evaluating broader impact.
competencies.competent: Considers ESG implications when prompted; beginning to incorporate sustainability criteria into routine decisions; supports organizational ethics policies.
competencies.proficient: Consistently makes decisions aligned with ESG goals and ethical guidelines.
competencies.exemplary: Acts as the moral compass of the unit; refuses profitable initiatives if they violate ecological boundaries, human rights, or ethical AI frameworks.
competencies.evidenceSource: Adherence to TBL P&L; results of internal compliance audits
